glsa.title: Opera: Command-line URL shell command injection
glsa.synopsis: Lack of URL validation in Opera command-line wrapper could be abused to execute arbitrary commands.

background.p: Opera is a multi-platform web browser.

description.p: Peter Zelezny discovered that the shell script used to launch Opera parses shell commands that are enclosed within backticks in the URL provided via the command line.

impact.p: A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by enticing a user to follow a specially crafted URL from a tool that uses Opera to open URLs, resulting in the execution of arbitrary commands on the targeted machine.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Opera users should upgrade to the latest version:
